name: DialogTrigger
description:
A button that opens the dialog.
Renders a `<button>` element.

handle.description:
A handle to associate the trigger with a dialog.
Can be created with the Dialog.createHandle() method.

nativeButton.description:
Whether the component renders a native `<button>` element when replacing it
via the `render` prop.
Set to `false` if the rendered element is not a button (e.g. `<div>`).

payload.description: A payload to pass to the dialog when it is opened.

id.description:
ID of the trigger. In addition to being forwarded to the rendered element,
it is also used to specify the active trigger for the dialogs in controlled mode (with the Dialog.Root `triggerId` prop).

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.

style.detailedType:
| React.CSSProperties
| ((
    state: Dialog.Trigger.State,
  ) => CSSProperties | undefined)
| undefined

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.detailedType:
| ReactElement
| ((
    props: HTMLProps,
    state: Dialog.Trigger.State,
  ) => ReactElement)

data-popup-open.description: Present when the corresponding dialog is open.

data-disabled.description: Present when the trigger is disabled.
